issue.title: MkContents.update() should create a commit and handle branches

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body: I think `MkContents.update()` should create a commit in addition to file update. Also, it should handle branches. See http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#update-a-file. Looks like this issue depends on #434.

body: I think it would be better if `Contents.raw()` returns a `byte[]` or a `*Stream` type. As for `Content.content()` returning a `String`, wouldn't that be better off in the `Smart` type?
@carlosmiranda I agree, `InputStream` is a good choice for `Content.raw()`, and a `String` in `Content.Smart.content()`
@carlosmiranda this is your task now, please help. The budget of it is **30 mins**
@yegor256 of course. @longtimeago many thanks for reporting, I just topped your account up for 15 mins, payment ID: `36498329`
@carlosmiranda You can continue on this issue. #607 has already been merged to master
